item.title: Investigated connection between 34 missing gamblers and anti -drug war in the Philippines
item.description:
Philippines are investigating a possible relationship between the disappearance of 34 men linked to bets on rooster fights and extrajudicial executions during former President Duterte's anti-drug war, a lawyer of the victims said yesterday. The connection between the disappearance and executions within the Anti-Drug War, carried out by Rodrigo Duterte, would reinforce the case before the International Criminal Court against the former president, told the broadcaster Filipina ABS-CBN Kristina Conti, one of the representatives of the victims' families. "It would be an additional evidence. The police, or in particular these death squads were involved in assassinations of activists and other directed murders," he said. The case of the 34 Sabungos -as they are known in the Philippines the fans of the struggles of the roosters -missing in 2021, has made headlines since one of the accused, Julie Padidongan, said they were killed and then thrown into the lake surrounding the Taal volcano. Padidongan accused businessman Charlie Ang, involved in lucrative online bets and for those who worked as security, to have ordered the murders, carried out by police officers. Philippine coastal diver teams continue to search the turbulent volcanic waters, a process that can take months, and has so far recovered several bags with human and animal remains that authorities are analyzing.
Other investigations The Secretary of Justice, Jesus Crispin Remulla, said on Monday that he was investigating whether police accused of the disappearances were also involved in extrajudicial executions during the Duterte War against the drug. "There are people involved in the murders of the war against drugs and e-sabong [online bets], that's all we can mention for now, but we have to establish clearer connections," he said. For its part, the presidential palace stressed that it will proceed to an exhaustive investigation into the disappearances, despite the criticism of family members for years of inaction in this case. "This will not be neglected, there will be no cover-up and the investigation will continue; this is what the president [Ferdinand Marcos Jr.] wants," said presidential spokeswoman Claire Castro at a press conference on Friday.

item.title: “Goodbye, My Concubine” ends season of the Chinese Orchestra
item.description: The concert that will end the season of the Macau Chinese Orchestra is scheduled for Saturday on July 26, at 8 pm, at the Great Auditorium at the Macao Cultural Center. item.title: Encounter | Dinner brought together more than 100 former military man recruited in Macau
item.description:
More than 100 military personnel recruited in Macao by Portugal were gathered at a fishermen's dock dinner to remember the “cheerful” times on the troop About 100 former military recruited in Macao between 1936 and 1975 were gathered on Tuesday night at a fraternization dinner that took place at the fishermen's dock. The second event in the five -year space aimed to bring together colleagues, miss other times, featured speeches for video conferencing and until a moment to sing the Portugal Anthem. One of those present at the event was 86-year-old Mario Lemos, and being the oldest recruit at the ceremony of 1959, he was entitled to sit at the table of the organizing committee, led by Francisco Marnhão. From the troop, Lemos recalls other times, more agitated: "The troop was a youth adventure, where I spent a year and a half. The recruit was six months and then passed to take office at the headquarters' office," he recalled. "I did practically everything because I had completed the second cycle, I did a lot of different things. I also translated because people from Portugal came and did not dominate the Chinese language. It often served with the guys of Portugal. At the time there were many people of Chinese ethnicity and many of them did not speak Portuguese," he said. Cantonese's dominion also led to that Mário Lemos often had to deal with the population's complaints in the face of the behavior of some troops, although highlighting that they were not very frequent things. "Sometimes there were even problems out there, people came to complain and I served as a translator to solve the subjects. For me it was a very excited time," he said. "But there were not many complaints. They were youth things," he said. And among the complaints, it was not uncommon for the population to complain about the harassment of the military to some younger girls. The former military man admitted to miss the troops and shows the military ballot proudly, where there is a praise received at the end of the time served in the army: "At the end of the troop I received a praise from the head of state of the military in Macau. It was not easy," he said. “I was very proud,” he confessed. The busiest times as a military contrast with retirement. After more than 30 years in the civil service, Lemos lived in Canada for 12 years before returning to Macao. Now life is calmer. "I am a person who always stays very at home, I do not have much social life," he acknowledged. Still admitted to like the environment of this type of dinners.
Rigorous José Madeira, at the age of 73, was recruited in 1974 in Macao, where he was born and lives. It is currently renovated after a civil service career, and took advantage of the conviviality to review some friends and put the conversation up to date. “It was a good occasion to be with friends. I know people almost all, because most are macanese, Macau is a small land and we know almost everyone. It's easy,” said Madeira, dressed in the alternative nightgown of the national football team. "For me it is not a matter of not seeing people, I regularly see these friends, because we have groups and we find ourselves regulate," he explained. However, the former recruit dinner is nonetheless different, recognizes Macaense, because it ends up making the conversations turn more around the troops. “At this dinner we remembered our times of youth and troops,” he said. During the period in the army, José Madeira performed the functions of nurse. "I didn't have much work, I usually dealt with routine daily consultations," he recalled. The most common cases implied allergies, especially among the military coming from Portugal. "The metropolitan military did not usually adapt to moisture and most of them suffered from skin allergies," he recalled. About the troop experience, Macaense recalls “a period of conviviality”, “friendship”, “solidarity” and “teamwork”. The recruit was the most complicated period, because in a macao when winter was more rigorous, it was necessary to get into the sea on the beaches, without the possibility of the military if they bathe or dry, so as to learn to deal with the adversities of combat.
Mandatory paths Recruited in 1970, 75 -year -old Mário Sin recruits from recruiting the impact caused by winter cold. "The weather was a little different, when it arrived in January it was very cold. Now not, the weather is always warmer," he recalled. "So the Malta suffered when it entered the recruit, because we were in winter," he shot. However, even if there was no desire, Sin pointed out that the recruit was mandatory, and without compliance with military service, professional opportunities were very limited: “At the time we had no alternative, we had to fulfill military service. Without the fulfillment of military service, it was not possible to work for the civil service, and we were not accepted in other work,” he said. However, Sin admits that the times as military were very happy: “The Malta enjoyed a little with that, every day were very happy. But there were very pulled exercises, the exercises were always pulled. But as the malta came from school had good energy to deal with it. "If it were now, there was no strength," he added to laugh. For Mário Sin dinner was another opportunity to live with several colleagues, with whom he admitted himself regularly.

item.title: Spain | Right -wing extremists chased journalists in Torre Pacheco
item.description:
About a hundred elements of the far right pursued and insulted journalists during the demonstration on Tuesday night to the Torre Pacheco Chamber in the Spanish region of Murcia, which was accompanied by security forces. The insults, according to EFE, were particularly intense against Esther Yáñez, a journalist at TVE station, who had to be escorted by the Civil Guard, during the demonstration against the aggression to a resident of the Spanish city, allegedly by three young men from Magheb. Members of the present security forces had to ask Yáñez to stop reporting so as not to incite the crowd to continue harassment, while some journalists had to remove sponges from microphones so that it would not be clear which means of media they represented, for fear of reprisals. Although sources close to EFE's armed forces initially indicated that police were encouraging participants to abandon the site, where dozens of people were concentrated under the motto "only the people save the people," the protest eventually gathered about 100 people. At around 10:00 pm on Tuesday, there was no movement in the neighborhood predominantly inhabited by Skinny, about 10 minutes walk from the center and was protected by numerous armed forces shock police, according to the Spanish news agency.
Immigrant hunt The protest increased the presence of civil guard agents on this day, with more than 100 elements of special groups, expecting another night of riots, similar to those of the last days. Spanish security forces had already released on Tuesday that the number of Torre Pacheco following disturbances triggered by immigrant mobilization rose to 13 after three more arrests at the last night. The disturbances and clashes between groups allegedly far-right and residents of Torre Pacheco, where 30 percent of the population of 40,000 people are immigrant or foreign origin, occurred in the last four nights and emerged after a 68-year-old man of the locality was assaulted by young people without apparent reason, according to the victim, last Thursday, the media. According to the authorities, three of the 13 detainees in recent days are related to this aggression and the rest are suspected of hate crimes, aggression and public disorder.

item.title: Traditional associations support exclusions
item.description: The reaction of traditional associations to the disqualification of two lists for the upcoming legislative elections was not expected, either through communications or statements to the newspaper or Mun, aligning with the position of the government and the central government's connection cabinet in the MSAR. Lao Nga Wong applauded justice and legitimacy of the decision of the Commission of Electoral Affairs to the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) and argued that the disqualifications were necessary to prevent the entry of "liars who say to love the homeland and Macao" in the "government structure." The member of the permanent committee of the Chinese people's political advisory conference, and President General Association of the Overseas Chinese of Macao, said that the exclusion of candidates eliminates risks to the interests of the country of Macao. In turn, the president of the Macao General Association of Macao, Lau Kam Ling, argued that deputies have to be “honest patriots”, otherwise it will harm the interests, sovereignty and national security, as well as Macao's prosperity and stability. Deputies Chui Sai Peng and Chui Sai Cheong praised that checking the ability of candidates who dismissed their colleague from Hemiciclo Ron Lam for ensuring the political stability and safety of the Macao regime. The president of the General Union of Macao residents' associations, NG Siu Lai, said that this type of candidate's ability verification is common practice worldwide, including Hong Kong. Also the President of the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations, Ho Sut Heng, applauded the work of the State Security Defense Commission, because it ensures the governance controlled exclusively by Patriots.

item.title: Elections | Disqualified candidates bind loyalty to masters and the country
item.description:
In the aftermath of the disqualifications of the two lists to the legislatures, the vetoed candidates underline their love for the homeland and the macao and the loyalty to the masters. Ron Lam believes that “the sun always comes after the storm”
Candidates vetoed by the Legislative Assembly Electoral Affairs Committee (Cael), which thus denies them the right to participate in the elections for the Legislative Assembly, respond with different voices to their exclusion, but all underline the same point: the unfailing love to Macau and the Fatherland.
One of the affected, Deputy Ron Lam from the Macao Synergy list, admitted that his exclusion "was very sudden." However, Lam remains optimistic: "I'm in a quiet conscience. My initial intention to Macau will not change. I believe the sun always comes after the storm," he added. Ian began by characterizing “sudden” the novelty and revealed that he became aware of the fact through the Caeal press conference. However, because it has now been disqualified, this does not mean that Ian alter his perception of the work done. "Looking at the years behind, regardless of the subject or position I took, I never diverted the original intention to serve Macao's society. I always felt that Macau could improve and this feeling became central to my goals. All my work was for the country and Macau," said the excluded candidate. Johnson Ian also assumed that his route was not made only of success, but is in a quiet conscience. After thanking the Macao synergy team and residents for the support shown after disqualification, Johnson Ian asked for a moment to reflect on what appears in the future. This is how environmentalist Joe Chan, who was the fifth candidate of the disqualified list led by Ron Lam, reacted yesterday to the decision of the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal). Shortly after the announcement that the list led by Ron Lam had been excluded after the political scrutiny of the State Security Defense Commission, Joe Chan proved to be "speechless." "I learned today that, apparently I do not support the basic law. I think it's time to fight for something that is worth it. I'm speechless, I was quietly disqualified," he said on social networks.

The disqualification of 12 deputies, announced on Tuesday by the Legislative Assembly Electoral Affairs Commission (Caeal), "means deputies have to be more politically correct and there are many more loyal than opponents," said Sonny Lo Shiu-Hing. "Changes to deputies' rules and regulations seem to point out in this direction," he added. Sonny Lo referred to approval, a week ago, in the Legislative Assembly (al) of amendments to the laws of the Deputies Statute and the normative of the Parliamentary Regiment, which reinforces the powers of the President of the Assembly and plasma in legal documents the “Macau governed by patriots” and the State Security Defense Law. The Macao Electoral Commission said on Tuesday that the State Security Defense Commission (CDSE) excluded, for lack of patriotism, two lists candidates for the elections for AL. The president of Caeal explained that 12 candidates from both lists "do not defend the basic law and are faithful to the Special Administrative Region of Macau of the Popular Republic of China." Exclusion covers six candidates from the Liveliod Popular Strength list in Macao, led by social worker Alberto Wong, who first competed in AL. The other list is the power of the synergy, led by the current deputy Ron Lam U Tou, who, in the last elections, in 2021, had been the seventh most voted, with 8,764 votes. Seng Ioi Man has ensured that the binding opinions of the CDSE, of which it is not possible to appeal, "have a clear and sufficient legal foundation" and have been elaborated "taking into account the facts." However, the judge refused to reveal the facts that led to exclusion, arguing that "the works and documents of the State Security Defense Commission are confidential."
All for one "We don't really know the reasons, because the electoral law and the National Security Act include a number of possible reasons," Sonny Lo told Lusa. On Tuesday, the president of Caeal had assured that the binding opinions of the CDSE, of which it is not possible to appeal, "have a clear and sufficient legal foundation" and were elaborated "taking into account the facts." However, the judge refused to reveal the facts that led to exclusion, arguing that "the works and documents of the State Security Defense Commission are confidential." The dissemination of these "may represent certain risks to national security, and should not even be published their content," he added.
Shortly after the announcement of the Electoral Commission, CDSE stressed in a statement that when a candidate is excluded for lack of patriotism, all other candidates from the same line are also removed. The government demonstrated, in another statement, "strong support" to the decision of the CDSE, which described as "a correct measure for the full implementation of the fundamental principle" Macao governed by patriots ". Thus, they will compete for the elections of September 14, six lists for direct suffrage, eight less than in 2021. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 by indirect suffrage, through associations, and seven are later appointed by the chief executive.

item.title: Casinos | Suspicious transactions fall 15 percent
item.description:
The latest data from the Financial Information Office (GIF) show a reduction in the number of suspicious financial transactions communicated by game operators and financial institutions
Between January and June, the number of suspicious financial transactions reported by casinos had a 15.0 percent break compared to the same period. The number was released by the Financial Information Office (GIF) of the Unit Police Services on Tuesday. The most updated figures show that in the first half of this year game operators reported 1,856 suspicious transactions. In the same period last year the number of suspicious financial transactions had been 2,181. The reduction by operators of the number of suspicious financial transactions communicated is pointed out as responsible for the general trend, in which there was a 12.6 percent reduction in the number of suspicious financial transactions reported in the territory. The total number of suspicious financial transactions received by the Financial Information Office of Unit Police Services during the first half of 2025 was 2.515, which means a 12.6 percent decrease over the same period as 2024, ”the information was mainly read. At the same time, the proportion of suspicious financial transactions reported by the operators descended from 75.8 percent of total transactions to 73.8 percent. "The suspicious financial transactions received from the financial sector and the game sector were 19.9 percent and 73.8 percent of the total number of suspicious financial transactions received, while those received from other institutions constituted 6.3 percent," was revealed.
Opposite Trends Regarding financial institutions and insurance companies, there was also a reduction in suspicious communicated transactions, from 556 in the first half of 2024 to 500. This decrease represented a 10.1 percent difference. The only area where the number of suspicious transactions has increased by the “other institutions”, which do not appear discriminated against on Tuesday's data by the financial information cabinet, but involving businesses such as pledge, jewelery, real estate or auction houses. In this area, within one year there were another 17 transactions, from 142 in the first half from 2025 to 159 for the latest period. The difference of 17 communicated transactions implies an increase of almost 12 percent.

item.title: New edition of the Macau Biennial starts Saturday
item.description: It is already on Saturday, 19, that begins another edition of Macau Art: Macao International Art Biennial, which has as its theme “Hello, what do you do here?”. On the first day, the main exhibition of the Biennial will be inaugurated at the Macau Museum of Art (MAM), and includes works by 46 artists from 13 countries and regions, presenting to the public about 80 works or sets. In this show, which is evident until October 19 this year, the public is "invited to reflect on the history and" local "memory of Macau", as well as the "complexities of the global situation and to explore the nature of life in depth." Artists such as Xu Bing, Bart Hess, Zhang Peili, Chan Hung-Lu and Kimsooja participate. Also on Saturday, at 3 pm, a moderate lecture by the Biennial curator Feng Boyi, who will be dialoguing with co-stupid Liu Gang and Wu Wei, along with artists Song Dong and Xue Feng. According to a note from the Cultural Institute (IC), these personalities will take advantage of the Macau Biennial as a “study case”, analyzing in the session “The themes of exposure, concepts, the details of implementation, the resulting discrepancies and the results, exploring the current state, the questions and dilemmas that curatorship currently faces, as well as thought, strategies and solutions involved”. Highlight for the fact that this lecture will take place in Mandarin and have only English translation. Alien Still on Saturday, two sessions of a workshop starred by artist Chan Hung-Lu. This event has as its theme “exploration of inner aliens”, using the exposed works and guidance of participants so that they can “mentally visualize other aliens through the mobile phone and reflect on origins and differences through meditation practices and image generation technology by artificial intelligence”. This workshop will be taught in Mandarin. The Macau Biennial is divided into six sections, namely the main exhibition, the public art exhibition, the city's pavilion, the special exhibition, the local curatorship project and the collateral exhibition, with about 30 exhibitions held between July and October this year.

item.title: Espionage | Beijing says Japanese trial was according to the law
item.description: The Chinese government yesterday defended the conviction of a Japanese citizen to three and a half years in prison for alleged involvement in espionage activities, ensuring that the process was conducted "according to the law." "China's judicial authorities treat cases with strict respect for the legislation, ensuring the legitimate rights and interests of the parties involved. In accordance with international conventions and the consular agreement between China and Japan, we facilitated the consular work of the Japanese party," the Ministry of Foreign Ministry Lin Jian said at a press conference. The spokesman also stressed that China "has always supported economic and commercial cooperation with Japan" and ensured that it has provided "a favorable environment for the legal work of Japanese companies and citizens in the country." "We welcome foreign companies that want to develop economic and commercial cooperation in China. As long as foreign citizens comply with the law and act under the legislation, there is no reason for concerns," he added. Chinese authorities had not yet officially confirmed the conviction, reported yesterday by the Japan ambassador to Beijing, Kenji Kanasugi, after the trial. "The Japanese citizen was sentenced to three and a half years in prison on suspicion of espionage. We consider this sentence extremely unfortunate," said the diplomat, quoted by the Japanese press. According to NHK public television, Kanasugi has assured that the Japanese government will continue to press for various ways so that the citizen will be released "as soon as possible" and will provide "all the necessary support." The case dates back to March 2023, when the man, Japanese pharmacist's employee Astellas Pharma, was arrested by the Chinese authorities while preparing to return to Japan. The suspect was accused of violating counter -espionage laws, but few details were made public.

item.title: SMG | Typhoon leads authorities to warn of intense heat
item.description: Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) predict the formation of a tropical storm that is expected to enter the Southern Sea of China during the weekend and may then affect the territory, although the trajectory is still uncertain. "It is expected that a tropical disturbance in the Northwest Pacific Ocean approaches the island of Luzon, in the Philippines, in the next two or three days, and gradually turned into a tropical storm, entering the northern part of the southern sea during the weekend," was reported yesterday on the portal of these services. According to the SMG, at this stage there is the possibility that the typhoon pass closer to the south of the mouth of Rio das Pérolas between Sunday and Monday, although the trajectory is still unknown. At the same time, there are intense heat predictions that will make you feel from tomorrow. "Due to the continuous influence of an anticyclone at high altitude and the gradual influence of peripheral subsidence of a tropical cyclone potential, the Macao wind will be weak, and it is expected that in the coming days (July 16-19) time is very hot," he was informed. "The maximum air temperature can reach or exceed 35 degrees Celsius. It is advisable to the population to pay attention to heat-caused diseases, avoid staying outdoors for long periods and drink more water," he was warned.

Brushes Museum Diving into Huzhou's past, entering one of the city's most picturesque streets. A Christian church dominates the street and around, stores occupy the part under the two -story houses. By the solidoes in the heads of some people, we realize that some of the business belong to Muslims. After refusing to be photographed, a tangerine salesman offers us a delicious fruit piece. Continuing, curiosity leads us to meet the stone bridge with three arches built in 1539, with some embedded ornamental stones. Hence and to southwest, we go to the garden of the painter and calciple Zhao Mengfu (1254-1322) Painter Museum. This was native of Wuxing (today Huzhou), named after courtesy and pseudonyms Songxue, Oubo and Shuijinggong Daoren. He was a descendant prince of the Song Dynasty, but he served the Mongols Yuan Dynasty as an official at the Hanlin Academy. As a painter, he specializes in the representation of horses and used recreating themes and styles of the old masters, with simple colors to make the landscapes. In addition to being a master of Tang Dynasty techniques, he was an excellent Caligraph, considered one of the main four in the history of Chinese calligraphy. Already in the garden, the serenity with which the green of the vegetation is combined in the lake with the brown of the rest pavilions, or in the woods of the tea houses, it takes us there a long time, recreating figures with the reflection in the waters of the ornamental stones. We have to leave the garden to visit the Brushes Museum which, despite being encompassed in the same room, has an autonomous entrance. Huzhou brushes are referenced as the best in the country and so you have to see how they are made. In chronological terms, the brush was invented in the late 3rd century A.N.E. By Meng Tian, a military commander of the Qin Dynasty. However, it is perceived by the painted vessels of different neolithic cultures, which must have existed for at least five thousand years. Therefore, Meng Tian will be linked, not to the invention, but to the improvement of brushes. Also the city of Huzhou is not the real place of production of the best brushes, but has won this title since in ancient times Shanlian, in the municipality of Wuxing, province of Zhejiang, was over his jurisdiction. The handwriting brushes made had their heyday during the Yuan Dynasty and are still considered among the best in all of China. Four steps are required to manufacture the HU brush, and the coat of the rabbit, the fingernail and the goat hair is used. After the fat is removed with tire juice, the hair is cut into equal sizes and enter a solution to clean them. They are then united at the base with arabic gum and after drying, united with a tile that unites them to the bamboo. With the brush made in its structure, the other phase of the process is passed. The hair is bumped to a porridge made of algae to put them together and with the wire wrapped a tip is created, the most important part of the brush. This wire that goes through the hair, on a lap gives the cone shape and also serves to remove the excess of the agglutinator papa. With extreme patience and skill, the brushes are clean, rounded, creating a tip, with good elasticity. Then the brush, ready, passes to the hands of another employee, where in the bamboo cable are recorded the characters Tian Kuan Trade Mark, which replaced the old “double goat” brand. The goat hair (HAO) brushes (HAO) are soft and serve to write small characters, rabbit hair are hard and those of the fingernail are between the two, with great elasticity for the handwriting of large characters. Sometimes a mixture of different hair is made, using those of other animals. There are brushes of all kinds of sizes, serving some to paint and others to call. The best for Chinese handwriting are the rabbit and goat hair mix. HU brushes were widely used in the imperial court. In the other part of the museum is the painter's room Zhao Mengfu with its utensils and some works, where the recorded stones are not lacking. Although the museum has a sales section, after leaving the museum enclosure and already on the street, a set of stores is dedicated to the sale of products for Chinese painting. Leaving the brushes, we visited the market and crossing a wooden bridge in Zig-Zag, we traveled another old part of the city. Clothing extenders hide salespeople with bags full of tea leaves finished spoon that belong to the first harvest of the year, the best. Our stay in Huzhou also serves to visit places at an hour of bus, such as Anji, to see the Bamboo Museum and already outside Zhejiang province in Jiangsu, Dingshan, referenced as the place of production of the best tea services. Between 2016 and 2017, the government planned to raise a museum about Coloane's stalps to tell the story of these peculiar houses of Macao. However, after news was published in the press to convey the inauguration of the project in 2017, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) confirmed to HM that no museum will be born. The cancellation in 2016 is still surprising, given that on June 14 of the same year the Jornal Tribuna de Macao (JTM) reported that the inauguration of the museum would take place in 2017. In this article, statements were cited by the director of STD, Helena de Senna Fernandes, made to the newspaper or Mun, explaining that the “project was in the [conception] phase of design”. According to JTM, the project should “be completed by the end of the year” in 2016, so that the work will be “started early 2017”, and STD expected “that the construction was completed in the same year”. The justification given by the STD was that Macau has not yet had the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas under his jurisdiction, something that has been legislated, precisely, since 2018. Now confronted with the official cancellation of the museum project, the official lamented the decision of the authorities. "The cancellation of the Museum of Slacinas project is not just news about a project that has not advanced, but a starting point to equate Macao's development priorities, the way the heritage is managed and what means for collective memory, in this case of Coloane," he said. In the opinion of the author of “The Colaane Grammar”, “The Plan for the Marginal of Rua dos Navegantes should include proposals for new buildings that use and reinterpret Madeira as the main and essential element of construction”, and the connection of this street with the Lai Chi Vun shipyards, “especially with regard to the sea front, is a unique opportunity to create a coastal corridor that celebrates Colona's seafront history”. "By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection," he argued, adding that dwellings, many of them left to abandonment, "could be reused for experience tourism, or cultural interpretation centers, valuing local history." They could also “be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the waterline, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification”. item.title: AL | New Regiment prohibits deputies from disseminating content of the commissions
item.description:
With the new Hemiciclo Regiment approved yesterday, the deputies are prohibited from publicizing the subjects discussed in the meetings of the permanent committees, except for their presidents and secretaries. The subject generated debate yesterday in the Assembly regarding the limits of what may or may not be said. Pereira Coutinho voted against this article
The deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL) are now prohibited from disseminating what is discussed at the Hemiciclo Commission meetings, "anyway," with the exception of its president and secretary. These usually disclose the content of the meetings at a press conference after their holding, and this will keep up. This new regulation arises after the vote and discussion, in general and specialty, the alteration to the al. It was one of the most discussed topics in yesterday's debate, with the deputies arguing on what may or can not be said, having José Pereira Coutinho voted against this concrete article. The disclosure of information from the meetings, which serves to analyze in the specialty proposals of law and always steering at the closed door, was something that was not yet regulated. Coutinho began by asking if he could disclose the information "during the plenary meeting", for example, having said that "he never heard of any deputy who had violated that duty." "There have been meetings in the past where the secretaries warned about the information that should not be disclosed and nothing has been said. We are only 33 deputies and we should think of the possibility of revealing what was discussed, because it is difficult to define borders about what can or can not be revealed and this will give rise to many discussions later," he said. The legislator also pointed out that "it can be difficult to execute this norm" and that "the principle of transparency" should be followed. Ho Ion Sang, who presided over to the commission that analyzed the new Al Regiment, explained that "the content of the meetings is subject to the duty of confidentiality and this matter was clarified." "The content can be said by the president of the commissions after the meetings, at the press conferences, and journalists can ask questions. In practice remains as always happened and that has given good results," he said. Meet the meetings Another point addressed, whether or not the permanent committees were held at the closed door, and Pereira Coutinho defended the opening to the public like what happens in Hong Kong. The AL regiment does not prohibit open meetings, but this always depends on a prior deliberation. But iau Teng Pio, deputy, advised against the opening of the meetings. "The purpose of the closed -door meetings is so that members of the government, advisors and deputies can argue at ease even if there is no final decision. Kou Hoi In, president of AL, recalled that “the spirit of the norm has not been changed” and that everything will remain in it, only the ban on what deputies cannot refer outside the commissions. "The reserved character of permanent committees is so that everyone can speak freely and if any deputy says this or that can spoil sensations of injustice in society to deputies and this cannot happen. We have to protect deputies and ensure confidentiality." At yesterday's meeting, there was also the discussion of the duty of the deputy to participate in all permanent committees, even in those to which he does not belong. Several deputies spoke of the need for better coordination of meetings agendas. "In the future there may be more practical coordination because there are many meetings and proposals of law. We can schedule the meetings so that there are more deputies," he said. Moreover, the new Al regiment prohibits deputies by "clothing or signs, banners, signs or other objects that have offensive content or political provocation, or undermine the dignity of the AL".

item.title: About 97 percent of Spanish adolescents victim of sexual aggression on the internet
item.description: About 97 percent of teenagers in Spain is the victim of some kind of sexual violence on the internet, warned yesterday the Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) Save the Children. The NGO released a report yesterday with the title “Networks that hold. Sexual exploitation of childhood and adolescence in digital environments”, which elaborated with the European Association for Digital Transition and which includes official data and an inquiry to over 1,000 Spanish young people aged 18 and 21. According to the study, 97 percent of these young people said they were victims of some kind of sexual violence on the Internet during adolescence, including contacts from adults for sexual purposes, unauthorized diffusion of intimate images or blackmail and threats to send intimate and sexual content. Another type of violence enhanced in the report is the use of artificial intelligence tools to create sexual content from a real image of adolescents or children (content known as 'Deepfake' or 'Ultra counterfeits'). According to the study, one in five young Spaniards was the victim of the creation and diffusion of these 'Deepfake' during adolescence, namely with sharing by another person, to third parties, and without consent, of their own nudity images, elaborated through artificial intelligence. "The internet, social networks and technologies not only facilitate capture and exposure to sexual exploitation -related risks, but can be the means by which these violence against boys and girls are committed and allow their perpetuation," said Save the Children, in a statement released from the study published yesterday. Starter Social networks are the most frequent way for aggressors to start contacts with the teenage victims, with the study also highlighting online video games in the case of boys. After this first contact, they move to applications and messages of messages such as WhatsApp, Telegram or Discord. Girls are the ones that most denounce to be pressured to send intimate content (28.5 percent of 18.4 percent of boys), with the study that all victims had shared personal or intimate information on the Internet during childhood and adolescence. According to the study, only 50 percent of young people when they were smaller considered contact with unknown people one of the main risks of the internet and only 32.9 percent mentioned as dangerous the consented send of intimate images to adults. On the other hand, 70 percent states that it has not seen as a risk, in adolescence, the manipulation of photographs and videos with artificial intelligence. Asked the reasons why they sent intimate or sexual images of themselves, 48 percent says it did not know it was something potentially dangerous, 46 percent weighed that it was normal and 42 percent sought attention, affection or some kind of validation. Alone at home In this context, Save the Children warns, in the study, for the lack of follow -up of minors; The scarce digital formation, in cybersecurity, privacy and recognition of danger situations and the intensive use of technologies by children and adolescents. According to data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Spain, cited in the NGO report, in 2023 there were 4,896 complaints for offenses on the Internet against children and adolescents, 1,068 of which were sexual crimes. "These numbers represent only the tip of the iceberg, as most cases do not know, in part, for the absence of denunciation and, in part, for the difficulties in detection, which increases when these facts take place in an online environment," said Save the Children Catalina Perazzo, quoted in the NGO statement.

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with a growing strategic interest of Beijing in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we end up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea, feeds, however, the interest of Beijing, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with the potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, the marine resources and eventually the cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Reports of four Sao Tomers who followed courses in China Denise, Lucineidy, Reginaldo, and Aithysa grew up under the sign of an alliance with Taiwan, until life and academic path were redefined by the rupture of diplomatic ties between Sao Tome and Taipei in 2016. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. It is very likely that behind the scenes would already outline the end of diplomacy between Taiwan and Sao Tome and Principe, but for this student of International Relations at the University of Ming Chuan, in Taoyuan, North Taiwanese, the news, who arrived a month after these celebrations, on December 21, was a surprise. “There was no rumors, nothing,” recalls Lusa Denise, now 29, working in marketing and living in Almada, Portugal. When the secondary finished, also the bonds between the island and the African nation, agreed in 1997, had just reached the age of adult. There was “very closeness” between the parts, with Taiwanese friendships in the family. Normality shaken this December 2016. Studying with a scholarship granted by Taipei, Denise and other St.-Tome students in Taiwan was given the option of continuing studies, without financial assistance, or being transferred to China as scholarships. Being at the end of the academic course, Denise remained in Taoyuan. Most, however, changed geography, university and life. Country “full of opportunities” Lucineidy Almeida, now 28, saw the arrival in Tianjin, northern China, as "a new restart" in a "country full of opportunities." Attending the second year of biotechnology in Taichung, this native of Santo António had some difficulty in following the degree in Mandarin. A limitation that would eventually surpass, evaluates today, but in China, had the possibility of studying in English pharmaceutical sciences. He says he learned of the diplomatic break through social networks and, like all students who spoke to Lusa, left criticism of conducting the process, with “many uncertainties”, information given “on time”, “a feeling of disrespect”, and, in the middle, the suspension of the bags. Two months after the announcement, he landed in Hong Kong, where he treated his visa, although he still unaware of what his final destination. Only upon arrival in Beijing was he told that he went to Tianjin, recalls Lucineidy, living today in Portugal, in Cacém, and working as an English and Portuguese interpreter in the medical field. Regarding the diplomatic interruption, it notes that "from what was realized at the time", it was "a monetary question": "in the sense that China offered more [to Sao Tomé] than Taiwan at the time could provide." The São Tome Prime Minister of the time, Patrice Trovoada, considered the unilateral break of relations as “the right”, taking into account the authorities' view of the country's development. "We decided the principle of joining one China and when adhering implies the cut of relations with Taiwan. The international scenario 20 years ago, not the same as today," he added. But the new political order did not take students to advance in the academic career. Aithysa Ramos, 32, is still in Beijing, where, after leaving Taiwan, she concluded the master's degree in business management. If this morning of 2016, the story had not taken this course, would probably have been in Taiwan, where he had lived seven years ago. At the time, it now remembers the English education teacher, was “devastated and angry”: “It was like my second home, I passed [part of] my adolescence, growth phases”. Reginaldo was in the second year of Business Management at the University of Yuan Ze, Taoyuan, when he stayed to the news. He realized that he “had no power” to change the course of history. The initial shock, assumes today, was really the cold. Despite admitting "it was" always a process of doubt, "China, where he moved two months after the cutting cut," it was a surprise for the better. " “Because I was still here, not coming back, I can say yes, it was the best thing that happened,” he says.

item.title: BRICS | Seventh Cimeira ends today with focus on Trump's fares
item.description:
Since Saturday, leaders in the countries that are part of the BRICS Group have been gathered in Rio de Janeiro for another summit designed to think about the reform of institutions and the inclusion of more emerging economies, as well as the fight against Trump's rates. Highlight for the absences of Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin
Since Saturday, Rio de Janeiro hosts the BRICS Group leaders, which ends today. The first day was based on the dialogue around the ambition of emerging economies to reform international institutions and the defense of multilateralism. "I think the main message is this: at the time of so many international crises, conflicts, we are experiencing a succession of conflicts that only increase from year to year, having a set of countries reaffirming the power of diplomacy, cooperation, the need to act jointly, to solve the problems of the population and not to generate more destruction, such as conflicts, it is an opportunity that we always have to take advantage of," Lyrio, guide of discussions and agreements of heads of state at the conference, designated by the Brazilian presidency of the BRICS. In all, about 30 countries and nine international organizations have been present, with the Brazilian head of state, Lula da Silva leading the meeting, which has Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, Angola President and African Union, Secretary-General of United Nations, António Guterres. The main absences are Russian and Chinese heads of state, two BRICS founding countries. Vladimir Putin, the target of a warrant of detention issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC), on suspicion of illegal deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia, will only participate in video conferencing. Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will be the representatives of the two founding countries of the group, which represents more than 40 percent of the global population and more than 35 percent of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) worldwide. From China with Love According to Chinese state agency Xinhua, Chinese prime minister promised to “expand cooperation with Brazil” in the areas of “digital and aerospace economy”. Li Qiang spoke on Saturday, as part of a meeting with Lula da Silva, noting that the country intends to “work with Brazil to take advantage of each other and expand cooperation in areas such as digital economy, green economy, scientific and technological and aerospace innovation”. Xinhua quotes words from Li Qiang, who referred to the fact that “China is ready to work with Brazil to continue efforts to enrich the dimensions of bilateral relations and achieve more concrete results in cooperation in order to provide more benefits to both peoples”. One of the points out of this meeting was the realization in 2026 of the year of China-Brazil culture, which provides for an intensification in cooperation in areas such as “education, youth and health”, in order to facilitate “more exchanges between peoples and strengthen public support to China-Brazil's friendship and cooperation”. “China is willing to work with Brazil to further consolidate and deepen bilateral cooperation in trade, finance and infrastructure development within the high quality cooperation of Belt And Road [track and route]”, the Chinese prime minister, who did not forget the great flag of this BRICS Summit: multilateralism. Thus, I read Qiang considered “the two countries as fierce defenders of multilateralism and free trade”, saying that “China is willing to improve communication and coordination with Brazil in multilateral structures such as the United Nations, BRICS and G20, work in union with developing countries to promote an equal and ordered multipolar world and universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, and provide more certainty and stability to the world. ” On the other hand, Lula da Silva said that "Brazil is willing to deepen communication and multilateral coordination with China, to oppose unilateralism and defend multilateralism and free trade in order to promote peace and world development." After the meeting between the two leaders, “cooperation documents in areas such as tax and financial matters, artificial intelligence, alignment of development strategies and aerospace” were signed.
Cuba's debut Cuba President Miguel Díaz-Canel also participates in the 17th BRICS Summit, being the first time Cuba has associated with this geopolitical and economic cooperation group. Under the motto “reinforcing cooperation in the global south for more inclusive and sustainable governance”, the BRICS Summit's agenda comprises two central axes: the consolidation of cooperation between the global southern countries and the promotion of reforms in international governance mechanisms. Created in 2009 throughout Brazil, Russia, India and China, BRICS admitted South Africa two years later and, since last year, integrates six new effective members: Egypt, United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia, Iran, Indonesia and Saudi Arabia. Brazil invited to this summit leaders from various Latin American countries, including Mexico, Colombia, Uruguay and Chile. The statute of associate, which takes Cuba to Rio de Janeiro, was approved in October 2024 during the summit of the group held in the Russian city of Kazan, which was made official in 2025, recalled the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Caribbean country. In addition to geopolitical issues, BRICS have sought in Rio de Janeiro in the organization's economic weight, namely in the financial domain, in which they have been looking for a dollar for years for trade in the group. The host president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, president of Brazil, stressed last Friday the importance of a mechanism with these characteristics, recognizing, however, that the current international political context is "complicated". What is on the agenda On the first day, the heads of state and government of the BRICS participated in two plenary sessions, particularly on "peace and safety and reform of global governance" and the second relative to the strengthening of multilateralism, economic and financial affairs and artificial intelligence. " In the latter, the revision of the ACCIORARY participation in the World Bank, the realignment of IMF shares [International Monetary Fund] and the increase in the representation of developing countries in leadership positions in international financial institutions and the importance of reforming the UN Security Council. In addition, as it has been happening during the BRICS ministerial meetings over the past few months, a complaint should be made to the increase in unilateral unilateral unilateral protectionist measures, in reference to the measures announced by the President of the United States, Donald Trump; as well as an appeal to reinforce the use of local currencies in trade between the bloc countries. Today the plenary session will be on “Environment, COP30 and Global Health”. The term BRIC was created by a Goldman Sachs analyst to refer to emerging economies who began to stand out worldwide beyond the US, with the BRICS first gathered at the level of heads in 2009. This is the first meeting that brings together the new group configuration with 11 member countries. Brazil has mobilized about 20,000 military personnel, as well as fighters with missiles, anti-drug systems and elite shooters to ensure the safety of the event. The safety operation, called Operational Command Redeemer Set, also provides for the use of 300 vehicles, 38 armored vehicles, 18 boats and eight helicopters.

item.title: Cape Verde | Évora family, between Macau and the rest of the world
item.description:
Tomorrow are 50 years of Cape Verde's independence, the country from which the first levada of the Évora family came out in the 1940s, towards Macao, where he won roots. Nowadays, only one member of the family remains in the territory, the cardiologist Mário Évora
There were once a dozen Évoras in Macao, where they arrived in the 1940s, but only Mario Évora resists, with the family repeating the migrations that mark both Cape Verde and the Macanese. "We have been between eight and ten Évoras in Macau," Sports Medicine expert Humberto Évora told Lusa from Lisbon, where he has lived since he renovated. The maternal grandparents of Humberto (the last of the family to be born in Cape Verde) and Mário (the first to be born in Macau) arrived in the east in the late 1940s, with five of the couple's six children. A year later, the daughter who had stayed with her husband in Cape Verde came to Macau, already with baby Humberto. The initial plan was for two years, but the couple ended up three decades and have three more children: Mario, Rui and Maria Helena. In 1971, it was the turn of Humberto and Mário to leave to study medicine in Lisbon, but not without a great fright linked to the colonial war that had lasted a decade ago. "As we went to the university we could postpone military inspection, but the papers did not come from Macao and we risk being considered refractory," said Humberto. The situation resolved, but Mario admitted to Lusa the fear of the mobilization. "We had this persecution, we had to go through the year not to go with the sides in the war," he explained. “The Shock” in Lisbon Upon arrival in Lisbon, “we were soon welcomed and integrated into the Cape Verdean student community,” said Humberto, at a time of student agitation and politics. "There were periods when it was almost daily, manifestations of students against the regime, the shock police enter the canteen inside and give some suckling," said Mario. Humberto admitted that "it was a shock, for those who came from Macau, where there was little political culture and the colonial war was seen as a struggle against terrorists." In a summer, the young man, who was integrated into a Cape Verdean group of intervention music, left with a friend "to the overseas ride out of guitar on his back." “I always remember the first time in France, that I saw the colonial war described on the contrary on television, the struggle for the liberation of a colonial power of occupation,” said Humberto. Independence When the two brothers finished the medical course, the independence of Cape Verde, on July 5, 1975, led them to the root return. "There was a movement of many of our colleagues to contribute to a new country, which was beginning to take the first steps," said Mario, then a formed cardiologist. Also because, recalled Humberto, some of the friends of Lisbon had, however, became members of the Government of Cape Verde. "There was this possibility, but the return to Macao, a place where it had spent so long, was natural," he explained. “I was born in Cape Verde, I spent part of my life in Portugal, I grew up in Macao, I am also Macaense. I am a citizen of the world,” said Humberto. Macanese are a Euro-Asian community, most of which Lusodescendants, with roots in Macau, although many have emigrated, due to the economic situation or fear created by the transition from Portugal Administration to China in 1999. From the Évora brothers, Rui, engineer, left before the transition to Cape Verde, where he even worked on the project of the Macao Hotel David Chow built on the beach, but was inaugurated. The younger sister, Maria Helena, a documentary science expert who has even worked in the Macao Historical Archive, is currently in the City Council of Oeiras. The children “are all out” between the United Kingdom, Cape Verde and Portugal, said Mario. "Now the world is smaller and it is going where there are opportunities," he said. Humberto also faces migrations "as a natural process, not only for Cape Verdeans, but even to the Macanese." Nothing that has prevented the two brothers from keeping their ties with the archipelago. Humberto divides the time between Portugal and Cape Verde, and has been the official doctor of Cape Verdean sports for decades to the main international competitions. Mario was one of the founders-and president for ten years-of the Macau-Cabo Green Friendship Association. "We had here Ildo Lobo, Tito Paris, and my cousin," said the cardiologist, before taking a break and adds, with a smile: "Cesaria Évora."

item.title: Investigated connection between 34 missing gamblers and anti -drug war in the Philippines
item.description:
Philippines are investigating a possible relationship between the disappearance of 34 men linked to bets on rooster fights and extrajudicial executions during former President Duterte's anti-drug war, a lawyer of the victims said yesterday. The connection between the disappearance and executions within the Anti-Drug War, carried out by Rodrigo Duterte, would reinforce the case before the International Criminal Court against the former president, told the broadcaster Filipina ABS-CBN Kristina Conti, one of the representatives of the victims' families. "It would be an additional evidence. The police, or in particular these death squads were involved in assassinations of activists and other directed murders," he said. The case of the 34 Sabungos -as they are known in the Philippines the fans of the struggles of the roosters -missing in 2021, has made headlines since one of the accused, Julie Padidongan, said they were killed and then thrown into the lake surrounding the Taal volcano. Padidongan accused businessman Charlie Ang, involved in lucrative online bets and for those who worked as security, to have ordered the murders, carried out by police officers. Philippine coastal diver teams continue to search the turbulent volcanic waters, a process that may take months, and so far recovered several bags with human and animal remains that authorities are analyzing.
Other investigations The Secretary of Justice, Jesus Crispin Remulla, said on Monday that he was investigating whether police accused of the disappearances were also involved in extrajudicial executions during the Duterte War against the drug. "There are people involved in the murders of the war against drugs and e-sabong [online bets], that's all we can mention for now, but we have to establish clearer connections," he said. For its part, the presidential palace stressed that it will proceed to an exhaustive investigation into the disappearances, despite the criticism of family members for years of inaction in this case. "This will not be neglected, there will be no cover-up and the investigation will continue; this is what the president [Ferdinand Marcos Jr.] wants," said presidential spokesman Claire Castro at a press conference on Friday.

item.title: Aviation | Deputy wants subsidy for flights between Macau and Lisbon
item.description: Deputy IP Sio Kai defends the need for the government to subsidize the initial exploitation of a direct flight between Macau and Lisbon. The position was taken yesterday at the Legislative Assembly, with the deputy warning that the lack of direct links to Europe compromises the role of MSAR as a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries. In the intervention before the agenda, IP pointed to official October data last year, indicating that “Macao International Airport had 40 regular direct routes to the interior of China and other regions of Asia”. However, he pointed out the absence of "direct medium and long course flights to Europe and Portuguese -speaking countries." The legislator considered that this failure "to some extent compromises Macao's connection role in the international network", and "the contribution and influence of Macao, as a platform between these countries." At the same time, IP stated that the direct connection between Macau and Portugal can function as a center with the other countries of the platform: “I think the opening of direct flights between Macau and Lisbon is the basis of a platform, which serves to connect, through the Portuguese airline, Brazil and Portuguese -speaking countries in Africa, which will further promote trade, tourism and the flow of people between Macau and European countries,” he said. In addition, for IP the lack of connections makes travel more inconvenient: “Due to the lack of direct flights to Lisbon, Macao residents and visitors have to travel through Hong Kong, Dubai, Istanbul, Shanghai, etc., which represents a long trip, having to change the airport or wait for connection flights, which makes the air traffic considerably inconvenient and not favored promotion and promotion. The normalization of Sino-Portuguese commercial and business activities, nor the attraction of more international tourists to Macao, ”he said. Cord Despite the suggestion, IP Sio Kai acknowledged that "this type of long -range routes have high operating costs and challenges such as the long period of clientele development." As the main costs pointed out the price of fuel, the salaries of flight and maintenance staff, the maintenance of the plane, the expenses of dropping and landing at the airport or the rates of use of the route. Given that the costs and initial difficulty of profitability tend to remove interested parties from the exploitation of direct connections, the deputy considers that the executive can assume part of the costs. "The government must study the creation of a specific subsidy to support the high costs of the initial exploitation of airline routes, for example, the expenses of traffic rights, airport rates, as well as the costs of personnel and fuel, assigning phased financial subsidies," he suggested. These subsidies can be attributed through a fixed amount according to the number of flights or, more flexible, through the gradual and phase reduction of an initially assigned amount of years of exploration of routes, in order to help airlines reduce initial risks and promote the entry into operation of these routes, ”he added. IP also asked to negotiate with Portugal's authorities to try to reduce part of the costs of flying to Europe, in aspects such as the tariffs charged at the airport.

item.title: Highly qualified investigator delivers food (II)
item.description: Last week we discussed the story of Ding Yuanzhao (丁遠昭), a highly qualified Chinese student. Ding Yuanzhao has a doctorate and worked as a researcher at a university. After his contract was not renewed, he began to deliver food. When his story spread on the internet, he became a close attention in mainland China. They were all concerned about the transformation that their life had undergone. The reason is simple. In Chinese culture, study is believed to grow character. In past times, it was the way to access high official positions. Therefore, the study is admired and appreciated by all. Even in the current Chinese society, parents do everything to make their children academic success and later a well -paid job. Ding's experience is incompatible with the traditional Chinese culture and naturally attracted everyone's attention. Ding made a video where he tells his story and carried it on the internet, stating that students who have good grades and those who have bad grades will not have future professionals; This is certainly a pessimistic statement. In society rich in information of our day, we must know that universities transmit knowledge to students to inherit them. Only when students inherit knowledge and produce innovation can society progress. And this is precisely what any society needs. Therefore, there will undoubtedly be a difference between the careers of the students who received university education and those who did not receive. It is impossible that “there is not much difference in future work.” Secondly, from an economic point of view, a university researcher working as a food delivery demonstrates that society has not yet completely recovered after the pandemic. It is estimated that there are more people with stories similar to Ding. Only when the economy recovers completely can problems be solved gradually such as unemployment and the disparity between academic background and work done. Perhaps Ding may consider asking the local work department to help you find a job suitable for your formation. Ding is a highly qualified person and human resources companies in the job market in general may not be able to find a compatible function. It will be beneficial for DING to seek help from government departments. In short, looking for work suitable for their formation of people to “take the biggest party from their talents”, is beneficial to society, employers and workers. Third, with the advancement of society and the democratization of education, more and more people receive university education and we can find doctorates everywhere. The increase of people with this academic degree is not accompanied by the increase of jobs suitable for their training, and therefore a situation is created in which there will be “more sailors than tides”, that is, in which demand exceeds the offer. A typical example is the place of university professor. In the past, it was easy to find placement as a university professor, as long as if he had a doctorate, but this is no longer the case; It is the result of the proliferation of academic qualifications. item.title: “Goodbye, My Concubine” ends season of the Chinese Orchestra
item.description: The concert that will end the season of the Macau Chinese Orchestra is scheduled for Saturday on July 26, at 8 pm, at the Great Auditorium at the Macao Cultural Center. item.title: Taipa Village | Fans painted by Chao Iok Leng on display
item.description: The exhibition “Chinese Foldable Fan Paintings by Chao Iok Leng” is inaugurated today at the Village Art Space Taipa, presenting to the public the aesthetic expression of the artist-based artist, which in this show came from the restricted confinement of the screen to a daily object: the folding fan. At a time when the portable fans have become an omnipresent object, Chao Iok Leng's artistic expression is a refreshing approach to the tradition of Chinese folding fan paintings with an undeniably skilled technique using China ink. The collection of painted fans represents a “rare intersection of function and beauty, in which the cooling function is accentuated by the artistic impression in its delicate role”, says the organization of the show. “This exhibition seeks to replenish our daily lives with an exotic object rooted in ancient Chinese culture and the assessment of the sublime,” is added by the organization of the exhibition. In this show, Chao Iok Leng adorned the fan of the fans with images inspired by floral motives (with hosts, glycies, peonies, magnolia, plums and lotus), fruits (pomegranate and lichia) and vegetables (kale, pepper, lenshades). Also appearing of animals, with insects and some birds, highlights the curator of the João Ó show. Each painting is accompanied by an inscription or a small poem that adds an additional context, revealing the artist's emotional view during creation. In the statement of the organization that presents the exhibition, the artist is mentioned explaining that "these are not genres of" dead natures ", but portray living elements that we see in our daily lives, but rarely enjoyed." Picture of the artist Chao Iok Leng, originally from Nanhai, Guangdong, lived in Macau for most of his life and, since childhood, has a deep and vast interest in art. In the early 1970s, he studied with Guan Wanli, learning the meticulous painting of flowers and birds, and later studied Western painting with Li Lun, mixing eastern and western styles. In the late 1970s, he moved to Hong Kong, where he studied flower and bird painting and landscape painting with Luo Zuishan and learned handwriting from Liang Zijiang. After returning to Macao, he studied Chinese and Western painting with Zhao Weifu and frequently went out to draw with his peers. In the 1980s, he studied Lingnan painting techniques with Zhao Shaoang and traveled to Beijing to learn the meticulous painting of flowers and birds with Xu Junxiu. Chao Iok Leng is vice president of the Macao Yi Un Caligraphy and Painting Association, Academic Counselor of the Macao Chinese Culture and Arts Association, Artistic Counselor of the Macao Association of Culture and Art, Honorary Counselor of the Macao International Women's Association and a member of the Society of Artists of Macao. In 1987, he held his first solo exhibition at the Luís de Camões de Macao Museum, with works collected by the museum. In 1996, he was invited by the Directorate of Tourism Services to hold an exhibition of Chinese paintings entitled “The Charm of Leisure”, and participated in numerous joint exhibitions both local and international levels. The exhibition “Chinese Foldable Fan Pantings by Chao Iok Leng” will be evident to the public until September 17 and is sponsored by the Culture Development Fund.
